title: Arts council to host free performance Thursday
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 5:39 PM Updated at 5:41 PM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 5:39 PM Updated at 5:41 PM The Cleveland County Arts Council is hosting a free jazz performance by Clyde Cumberlander from 6 to 7 p.m. on Thursday. This performance is in conjunction with the arts council's African American Music Trails exhibit. The arts council will host several live performances by local performers throughout the duration of the exhibit. Oct. 22: A Night of Gospel Music presented by the Music Ministry of Mt. Calvary Baptist Church, from 7 to 8:30 p.m. This program will feature a history of Gospel music, highlighting traditional spirituals, Civil Rights inspired Gospel music and contemporary Gospel songs. Oct. 29: Jondra Harmon will perform spirituals and opera from 6 to 7 p.m., with Dr. Bruce Moser accompanying her. Harmon is professor of voice, opera and vocal pedagogy at Gardner-Webb University. Moser is professor of piano, piano pedagogy and literature, music history and music theory at Gardner-Webb. Nov. 3: Christina Battle and Abiyd Coleman will perform Capoeira and African dance at 6 p.m. Battle and Coleman will give a short talk on traditional African Capoeira as well as a demonstration. - Staff reports
